greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Pascal-(1,8,1) array.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of table, flattened
formula: Number triangle T(n,k)=sum{j=0..n-k, binomial(n-k,j)binomial(k,j)9^j} Riordan array (1/(1-x),x(1+8x)/(1-x)). As a square array read by diagonals T(n, 0)=T(0, k)=1, T(n, k)=T(n, k-1)+8T(n-1, k-1)+T(n-1, k)

E.g.f. for the n-th subdiagonal, n = 0,1,2,..., equals exp(x)*P(n,x), where P(n,x) is the polynomial Sum_{k = 0..n} binomial(n,k)*(9*x)^k/k!. For example, the e.g.f. for the second subdiagonal is exp(x)*(1 + 18*x + 81*x^2/2) = 1 + 19*x + 118*x^2/2! + 298*x^3/3! + 559*x^4/4! + 901*x^5/5! + .... - _Peter Bala_, Mar 05 2017
mathematica: Table[ Hypergeometric2F1[-k, k-n, 1, 9], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 24 2013 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Aug 28 2008
